definitions.example: She was as naked as the day she was born.

definitions.definition: Lacking some clothing; clothed only in underwear.

definitions.example: The naked facts lay there on the table, enclosed within the files.

definitions.definition: Characterized by the nakedness of the people concerned or to whom the described noun is attributed.
Unprotected, uncovered; (by extension) without a condom.
definitions.example: I entered her naked and came in her too.

definitions.definition: (of a derivative contract) Where the writer (seller) does not own the underlying asset to cover the contract.
definitions.example: a naked put, a naked call

definitions.definition: (of land, rocks, or plants) Barren, having no foliage, unvegetated.
Uncomfortable or vulnerable, as if missing something important.
definitions.example: I feel naked without my mobile phone.

definitions.definition: (of food or other consumer products) Without any additives, or without some component that would usually be included.
definitions.example: Naked Bacon (a brand without nitrates or phosphates)

definitions.definition: Of a singularity, not hidden within an event horizon and thus observable from other parts of spacetime.
